Package general

Class SimulationA

  • java.lang.Object
    • general.SimulationA
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SimulationI
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GridSimulation
    public abstract class SimulationA
extends java.lang.Object
implements SimulationI
    This class provides an abstract implementation of the SimulationI interface to minimize the effort required to implement it.

    It's a simulation driven by time, so it already has the attributes currentTime, finalTime, numEvents and a PEC to contain the events of class Event waiting to be simulated.

    It provides the method init, where it resets the dynamic variables, and a method to add a list of new events to the PEC. The method simulate depends on the specifics of each simulation, so it has to be implemented in a subclass that extends this class.

    See Also:
    SimulationI

    • Field Detail

      • simComms

        protected SimulationCommands simComms
        Number generators (random or deterministic) that command how the simulation evolves.

        They may be related to the the generation of the time between the events or to any other generation of numbers in which the events of this simulation are based.

      • currentTime

        protected double currentTime
        Current instant of the simulation.

        Final instant of the simulation.

        Current number of events of the simulation.

        protected PEC pec
        Pending Event Container with the events to be simulated.

      • getFinalTime

        public double getFinalTime()
        Returns:
        the final time of this simulation

      • setFinalTime

        public void setFinalTime​(double finalTime)
        Parameters:

      • getNumEvents

        public int getNumEvents()
        Returns:
        number of realized events

      • setNumEvents

        public void setNumEvents​(int nevents)
        Parameters:
        nevents - - number of realized events to set to this simulation

      • init

        public void init()
        Resets the variables that change with the simulation of the system is performed.

        Sets the current time and the number of events to 0, and clears the PEC.

        Specified by:
        init in interface SimulationI

      • addNewEvents

        protected void addNewEvents​(java.util.List<Event> eventList)
        Adds a list of new events to the PEC.

        Additionally, the events are only added to the PEC if it's time is less than the final time of the simulation.

        Parameters:
        eventList - - list with the events to be added to the PEC
